intro: Parathesis obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed parathesis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and thrives in tropical climates. Its bark contains compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. The species is noted for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
